title: How to pronounce the Japanese word Ikigai - Quora

response.answer_text: The pronunciation of “ikigai” is as follows: Let’s disassemble “ikigai” into 4parts, i + ki + ga + i. “i” is pronounced “i” of “it” or “ink”. “ki” is pronounced “ki” of “kick” or “kiss”. “ga” is pronounced “ga” of “garden”. “i” is again pronounced “i” of “it” or “in”. There is no stressing accent when you pronounce it. Just flat tone, one part by one (separately). It should sound “i ki ga i“. If you are interested in Japanese, you had better learn Japanese alphabet (HIRAGANA ) first. Each letter of HIRAGANA represents sound only and never change its sound wherever it is used. For example “ikigai” is written ”いきがい” in Hiragana. ”い” is “i”、”き” is “ki”、”が” is “ga”. As far as the pronunciation is concerned, Japanese alphabet is much easier then English alphabet. You may want to study another Japanese alphabet, KATAKANA as a next step. Both Japanese alphabets are not difficult compared to KANJI (漢字).
